thread.title: James Harden makes history with his second 50-point triple double of the season
thread.title_full: James Harden makes history with his second 50-point triple double of the season

author: Whitney Medworth
title: James Harden makes history with his second 50-point triple double of the season
text:
Harden is have an unbelievable season
Let’s just get to the point here. James Harden is having an absolutely ridiculous season with the Houston Rockets . For the first time in NBA history, James Harden has recorded two 50-point triple-double games in one season. 
December 31st: 53 points, 16 rebounds, 17 assists vs Knicks 
January 27th: 51 points, 12 rebounds, 12 assists at 76ers 
To break it down even further, there have only been two 50-point, 12 rebound, 12 assist games in the NBA since 1983 total. Harden has both of them in this season alone.
We can break it down even further than that.
James Harden has two 50-point triple-doubles in last 28 days. 
The entire NBA went 15,258 days (from 1/19/75 to 10/28/16) w/o any such games
— Ben Golliver (@BenGolliver) January 28, 2017 This is Harden's 14th triple double this season. Before this season, the Rockets franchise record for triple doubles in a career was 14, by Hakeem Olajuwon.
Tonight was also Harden's fifth 40-point triple-double this season, tying Oscar Robertson in 1963-1964 for most in one season.
WHEW ... and there’s more.
All five of those 40-point triple-doubles have come in the last 28 days.
Dec. 31 53 points, 16 rebounds, 17 assists vs Knicks
Jan. 8 40 points, 10 rebounds, 11 assists at Raptors 
Jan. 10 40 points, 15 rebounds, 10 assists vs Hornets 
Jan. 17 40 points, 12 rebounds, 10 assists at Heat 
Jan. 27 51 points, 12 rebounds, 12 assists at 76ers
James Harden is making a hell of a case for MVP this year.
